background_video_fallback.alt: Jorge Baltre from Yacahueque drinking water from a facet

settings.editor: According to UNICEF, 703 million people worldwide lack access to clean drinking water, and many millions also lack basic sanitation and medical care. Last year, friends like you helped us bless more than 295,000 people with clean, safe drinking water and ship 3.5 million bottles of medicine to those in need. This year, with your help, we can quench the thirst of the poor, improve sanitation and hygiene, and help families access critically needed medicine and health care.

settings.title: A gift of $49 provides clean water to a family of four.

settings.editor:
In rural Kenya, 37% of people don’t have access to a clean water source. That means women and girls, the primary collectors of water within Kenyan families, must walk long distances just to collect contaminated water from a shallow open well.

This water makes people sick, and collecting it consumes valuable time from families who are already struggling in poverty. Adults miss opportunities to generate income to improve their families’ situations, children often miss school, and everyone has less time for important spiritual formation activities like Mass and prayer.

image.alt: A woman with a child on her back and a dog next to her collects water from a dirty stream

settings.editor:
Cross Catholic Outreach has worked for years with local dioceses to drill wells and provide families with clean, accessible water — but there is still much work to be done. Vast stretches of rural areas in Zambia, Malawi, Ghana and Kenya lack safe water sources.

Cross Catholic Outreach partners with ministries in Africa to build wells and teach good hygiene and sanitation practices. Just since 2018, we have successfully brought life-giving water to 1.2 million people in seven sub-Saharan nations, and with your help we can do so much more! Depending on local needs, our Church partners will provide systems ranging from low-maintenance hand-pump boreholes to solar water systems with elephant-resistant elevated storage tanks.

Together, we can help Church leaders in these developing countries meet the urgent needs of the poor, providing a desperately needed source of life and vitality for communities.

Cross Catholic Outreach’s Water for Life project will provide:

• GHANA: Five hand-pump and five solar-powered water systems.
  • KENYA: 52 solar-powered water systems.
  • MALAWI: 20 wells, along with maintenance for five existing wells.
  • ZAMBIA: 100 wells serving 106 communities.

Please help more than 590,000 people in rural Africa escape waterborne diseases, achieve greater stability and discover the blessings God has in store for them!

This project is part of a larger initiative to support Cross Catholic Outreach’s Water for Life Africa Relief Fund. Donations made to this project will provide families with clean water, spiritual outreach and other lifesaving aid.

settings.title: Join Cross Catholic Outreach in building nearly 200 clean water and sanitation systems, blessing over half million people with a lifetime supply of safe, clean water and a healthier future.

settings.nothing_found_message_text: It seems we can’t find what you’re looking for.

settings.title: Your donations are the driving force behind our mission.
